item.description: The Winter Olympics of Milano Cortina 2026 is another where Russian and Belarusian athletes will be largely absent, although there are a handful competing as individual neutral athletes.

item.description: Tiffani Phelps de Wildt died after collapsing on a remote station in WA's north. Her family says, had they known the risks, they would have tried to stop her from going out in the heat.

item.description: Donald Trump has, until now, thrived in controversy. But the US president has now done something that a year ago would have been unthinkable: deleted a social media post.

item.title: The Mark of Cain lead singer on a lifetime masking the truth
item.description: The lead singer of legendary Adelaide rockers The Mark of Cain this week announced she was transgender, but it comes after nearly 60 years of hiding the truth from everyone.

item.description: US prosecutors are seeking a sentence of almost four years for a conspiracy theorist linked to the trio behind the Wieambilla shooting.

item.title: Pregnant women in WA's Kimberley face big distances to hospital and high rates of heart condition, diabetes
item.description: Pregnant women in WA's Kimberley experience high rates of preventable health conditions, hours of travel to receive basic care and limited support.

item.description: As Thailand prepares to head to the polls, voters remain wary that in their version of democracy, the party they vote for is not always the one that takes power.

item.description: Australians flock to Japan each year to take advantage of its unique and plentiful snow, but it's not just the travel costs that are mounting.

item.description: A funeral home owner who stashed 189 decomposing bodies in a building over four years and gave grieving families fake ashes has been sentenced to 40 years in prison.

item.description: Australia's Valentino Guseli falls short of reaching the podium in the men's snowboard big air final on day one of the Milano Cortino Winter Olympics.

item.description: A permission structure has been crafted for Liberals to ditch the first woman to lead the federal party room before she has even had a year in the role.

item.description: From rare cancers caught early to dementia foretold decades in advance, newborn genomic testing raises an unsettling question: Just because we can know, should we?

item.description: Xavier Rudd performs solo these days, but he carries a spirit with him wherever he goes.

item.description: Fraudsters taking advantage of people with disability now appear to be targeting veterans, prompting a $200 million crackdown by the federal government.

item.description: Australia makes a hot start to the Rugby Sevens in Perth, with both the men's and women's teams going unbeaten in securing semifinal berths.

item.description: As the West reacts to the revelations in the latest batch of Epstein files, China has plans for the renminbi to become a global reserve currency.

item.description: The barking of a dog kicks off a marathon medical effort that ends in a rare lifesaving surgery at a remote hospital.

item.title: How Jamie Pherous grew a travel giant, and exited amid an overcharging scandal
item.description: Australian travel mogul Jamie Pherous, who grew a three-man operation into a multi-billion dollar success, foundered on the rocks of an accounting scandal in the UK.

item.description: The ABC can reveal the state government has paid almost $500 million to tens of thousands of victims of crime over the past three financial years.

item.description: The Tasmanian government is developing a public homebirth model that would allow midwives working in the public system to support women to labour from their homes.

item.title: How a Canberra-based refugee fled the Maduro regime along with millions of other Venezuelans
item.description: Josh Madrid was arrested for attending a pro-democracy protest in Venezuela. 24 hours later, he fled his homeland, fearing he would be killed by the government.

item.title: New hope for national gun register 30 years after it was first proposed
item.description: First proposed after the Port Arthur massacre in 1996, Australia still doesn't have a national gun register. As Queensland parliament sits for the first time since national gun reforms became law, advocates say it is time to centralise firearm information.

item.title: Coalition reunited after last-minute deal
item.description: The Liberals and Nationals have reached a breakthrough deal to reunite the Coalition after 11th-hour talks.

item.title: Heat and fires expose ancestral remains in Victoria's north-west
item.description: Ancestral remains that could be thousands of years old have been uncovered by erosion, dust storms and bushfires in Victoria.

item.title: The slow death of Keir Starmer's prime ministership after Peter Mandelson's 'betrayal'
item.description: Starmer's decision to hand the plum job of UK ambassador in Washington to Lord Peter Mandelson, despite knowing Mandelson had maintained a friendship with Jeffrey Epstein well past Epstein's conviction for soliciting underage prostitution, may simply be too large an error of judgement for the public to accept.

item.title: Before opening Meg's Bookshop in 1991, the Arnolds were told kids 'didn't read' in Port Pirie
item.description: In one of Australia's most disadvantaged regions, more known for its lead than its literature, a couple wanted to open a book store but were told children didn't read books there. They did it anyway, and it went on to become a "world class" institution.

item.description: It was 18 months ago that Valentino Guseli blew out his ACL attempting a backside 1800 at the Beijing big air. At the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics snowboard big air final, he put that ghost to rest.

item.description: A South Korean cryptocurrency exchange apologises after mistakenly transferring more than $60 billion worth of bitcoin to users, which briefly prompted a sell-off on the platform.

item.description: Brad Arnold, a founder and the lead singer of American rock band 3 Doors Down, dies nine months after revealing he had kidney cancer.

item.description: Police are investigating three incidents of damage on lines around Bologna, and have not ruled out a potential link to the Milan Cortina Games.

item.description: In a video posted to Instagram, the host of NBC's Today Show appears to directly address her mother's kidnappers, telling them she and her siblings have "received your message, and we understand".

item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says the federal government's budget in May will focus on productivity, spending restraint and tax reform.

item.description: The Palestine Action Group lodged submissions late on Sunday afternoon, arguing the declaration was "draconian" and imposed rules unsuitable for protest activity.

item.description: He's been declared bankrupt repeatedly, and was a gambling addict. Now he's linked to a $1.5 million fine for illegal tobacco.

item.description: The Australian women are forced to settle for silver at the Perth Sevens, while the Aussie men claim bronze in thrilling fashion.

item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting "locally severe heatwave conditions" from Tuesday, culminating in a maximum of 35 degrees in Brisbane on Thursday.

item.description: Mia Pilbrow is taking legal action against a Northern Territory hospital and calling for the territory to adopt tailored pre-term labour guidelines, after medical staff sent her home seven times during her pregnancy, repeatedly assuring her the baby was fine.

item.title: Dimitri D'Elio, Kylie Stott jailed for Christmas Eve killing of Charlie Gander in Bunbartha, Victoria
item.description: Charlie Gander’s body was found in a burnt-out car on a country road on Christmas Eve, 2022. Today, two people were sentenced to a combined 36 years in prison over his death.

item.description: When hundreds of people evacuated the Daly River community due to flooding, most had to leave their pets behind. But a nearby family swung into action to help.

item.description: Australian's Tess Coady and Mela Stalker miss the podium in the snowboard big air final, while Holly Harris and Jason Chan become the first Aussies in 12 years to represent the country in ice dancing.

item.title: Shaun Dunk asks to be 'locked up' 15 days before alleged stabbing murder, court hears
item.description: Fifteen days before he allegedly killed a woman and attempted to kill another, Shaun Michael Dunk asked to be taken into custody so he would not be a danger to anyone.

item.title: Police and protesters clash at Sydney's Town Hall
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: William and Kate 'deeply concerned' about Epstein files as Andrew faces fresh scrutiny
item.description: The Prince and Princess of Wales say their thoughts remain focused on the victims of the late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, in their first statement on the issue.

item.title: Queensland health minister orders review of Toowoomba Hospital maternity unit
item.description: Announcement comes after a woman reveals her support person was prevented from entering the birth suite while she was in labour by Toowoomba Hospital security.

item.title: Maritime safety regulator investigating luxury Carnival cruise ship after whistleblower concerns
item.description: The maritime union says crew members of a luxury Carnival cruise ship allege they are being made to sleep in crowded rooms, lack access to safe free drinking water, and that some are earning as little as $2.50 an hour.

item.title: Commonwealth files defence against Linda Reynolds legal action in federal court
item.description: The Commonwealth files its defence against former senator Linda Reynolds, who is suing the government and its lawyers over a $2.4 million payout it made to Brittany Higgins.

item.title: Ex-Tropical Cyclone Mitchell expected to batter the Gascoyne region as it moves inland
item.description: The system is expected to bring strong winds and heavy rain as it moves inland through the Gascoyne region.

item.title: Scottish Labour leader calls for UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer to quit
item.description: Keir Starmer is facing calls to resign after damaging revelations about the man he picked to represent the UK in Washington.

item.title: US seizes tanker in Indian Ocean that fled Caribbean blockade
item.description: The Pentagon says the vessel was operating in breach of Donald Trump's orders on sanctioned ships in the region.

item.title: King stands ready to help police with Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor investigation, palace says
item.description: Police have confirmed they are assessing information provided to them that former prince Andrew had passed late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein confidential reports while the former royal was British trade envoy more than a decade ago.

item.title: First stage of Marinus Link approved by Australian Energy Regulator despite uncertainty about impact on bills
item.description: The energy regulator has approved the first stage of the Marinus Link electricity connection between Tasmania and Victoria, and the associated transmission line, but it's not known what effect it will have on Tasmanians' power bills.

item.title: ABC Timelines quiz: Test your memory of the 2020s … so far
item.description: Today we're testing your memory of some of the major events of the 2020s in pop culture, sport and world news. Your challenge is to pick which happened first.

item.title: What happens when a medal is shared at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: In the men's team combined Alpine skiing event at the 2026 Winter Olympics, the Swiss and Austrian teams tied for silver. So what happens to the bronze medal? And when there was a tie for bronze in the men's ski jumping, was there a spare bronze?

item.title: Tasmanian cartoonist Jon Kudelka and the art of cutting through political spin
item.description: Hailed as an artist who "knew the power of comedy in holding truth to power", Jon Kudelka once described himself as "like a monkey with an automatic rifle".

item.title: Brisbane Broncos captain Adam Reynolds holds hope of Payne Haas contract backflip
item.description: Brisbane prop Payne Haas is set to arrive in England for the World Club Challenge where his teammates will try to convince him not to honour his deal with South Sydney.

item.title: Two people seriously injured in stabbing and hit and run near Swan Hill
item.description: Victoria Police says a man turned himself in after allegedly running over a man and stabbing a woman near Swan Hill on Monday night.

item.title: More people say they'll vote One Nation. What are they voting for?
item.description: One Nation questions if man-made climate change is real, wants to wind back access to abortion care and plans to pay the HECS debts of doctors working in the regions.

item.title: Roblox on notice after 'disturbing' reports of child grooming
item.description: The government puts popular social gaming site Roblox on notice following media reports of children being approached and groomed by predators on the platform.

item.title: Painkillers and HRT therapies among drugs not being subsidised under PBS
item.description: Painkillers, HRT therapies and incontinence medicines are among the drugs that will not benefit from the new maximum $25 script price.

item.title: St Kilda star Max King injured again, Port ruckman Ivan Soldo out for season
item.description: Max King has suffered another injury, further frustrating the St Kilda key forward's bid for an AFL return.

item.title: Shield and First Guardian collapses spur managed investment scheme crackdown
item.description: The federal government plans a crackdown on managed investment schemes following the collapses of Shield Master Fund and First Guardian.

item.title: How AI is disrupting the tech boom on global markets
item.description: Amongst tech investors the penny has finally dropped about just what the future may hold, and many are backing off or at least rethinking their strategy.

item.title: Cheryl Grimmer's family fights for new charges against suspect
item.description: NSW Parliament will again debate the 1970 disappearance of toddler Cheryl Grimmer, following claims her family's pleas for fresh charges against a suspect who confessed to murdering her when he was a teenager have been ignored.

item.title: Pakistan reverses cricket T20 World Cup boycott and will face India in Sri Lanka
item.description: Pakistan has ‍agreed to play India ​in the ⁠T20 World Cup match scheduled to take ‌place in Colombo this ‍Sunday, February 15.

item.title: Former ATSIC head Geoff Clark was jailed but his community says legal issues persist
item.description: Former ATSIC leader Geoff Clark was jailed in 2024, yet some members of his community say legal issues linger on.

item.title: Bodies corporate urged to be cautious after alleged $2m strata account fraud
item.description: The loss of $2 million from strata property accounts on the NSW Mid North Coast triggers concerns about the protection of shared assets.

item.title: First national plan to address violence against Indigenous women and children
item.description: The first standalone national plan to tackle domestic violence against First Nations women and children was "hard fought for by Aboriginal women", an advocate says.

item.title: Native title holders take appeal over one of Australia's largest groundwater licences to High Court
item.description: The cultural value of water will be front and centre in the High Court in Canberra today as a group of native title holders from Central Australia fight to assert cultural rights over an aquifer under their lands.

item.title: Angus Taylor faces pressure to challenge for Liberal leadership
item.description: Liberal leadership aspirant Angus Taylor is facing pressure from conservative supporters to challenge Sussan Ley this week and end the damaging speculation paralysing the party.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell will only talk if Donald Trump grants clemency, lawyer says
item.description: The jailed accomplice of sex predator Jeffrey Epstein refuses to answer questions for the US Congress — but her lawyer says she will cooperate if granted clemency by the president.

item.title: Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi sizzle, but Wuthering Heights isn't quite the full Brontë
item.description: The two Queensland "bogans" put on a show, but Emerald Fennell's Wuthering Heights is more wish fulfilment than a meaningful adaptation of the classic novel.

item.title: States urged to sign National Water Agreement even though users unaware what's in final version
item.description: As the country's state governments and territories consider signing a new national water policy that seeks to address climate change and elevate First Nations knowledge, the agriculture industry fears it has been overlooked.

item.title: Live: Joyce calls for Grace Tame's AOTY title to be stripped over intifada chant
item.description: Barnaby Joyce has called for Grace Tame to be stripped of her Australian of the Year title over her intifada chant at a protest against Isaac Herzog's visit to Australia. Follow live.

item.title: Swifts Creek faces tough task of reinventing itself amid job losses
item.description: Job losses mean Swifts Creek in Victoria's High Country is facing an identity crisis, but it is not the only small town undergoing a transformation.

item.title: Premier fights back at police brutality claims as videos show violent clashes
item.description: Twenty-seven people were arrested, including 10 for assaulting police, on Monday night at a demonstration against Israeli President Isaac Herzog's visit to Australia.

item.title: Witness vision appears to show police punching protester multiple times
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Live: ASX trading higher as miners make solid ground
item.description: The ASX 200 trades higher as BHP Group and Rio Tinto make solid ground, but the big banks retreat. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: McLaren unveils livery for MCL40 ahead of 2026 F1 season, Piastri and Norris excited about new challenge
item.description: McLaren has unveiled its livery for the 2026 Formula 1 championship season, retaining the design that helped it win championships in the previous two seasons.

item.title: Jake and Chris Waterman relishing prospect of AFL Origin as Perth prepares for Victorian invasion
item.description: WA's last State of Origin captain Chris Waterman is relishing the prospect of the concept's reboot — and can't wait to see his son Jake donning the famous black swan for the clash.

item.title: Turtles discovered in Dumaresq Dam could be dumped pets
item.description: The unexpected discovery of four turtle species in a dam near Armidale has left researchers wondering if people have been dumping unwanted pets.

item.title: Savannah Guthrie makes latest video plea as missing mother's ransom deadline nears
item.description: US TV host Savannah Guthrie says her family is at its "hour of desperation" in the search for their kidnapped mother, but makes no mention of a possible ransom in a new video.

item.title: Barnaby Joyce taps into rural anger as One Nation eyes Coalition seats at the Victorian election
item.description: The right-wing party's prized recruit, Barnaby Joyce, made a key appearance deep in National Party territory as the 2026 Victorian election campaign began to take shape, Richard Willingham writes.

item.title: Catherine O'Hara's cause of death revealed as pulmonary embolism
item.description: Award-winning actress Catherine O'Hara died from a pulmonary embolism, according to her death certificate.

item.title: NSW Police chase pro Palestinian protesters
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Lindsey Vonn set for multiple surgeries but denies torn ACL contributed to Winter Olympic crash
item.description: American ski great Lindsey Vonn will "require multiple surgeries" after sustaining a tibia fracture, but denies that her previously ruptured ACL was the cause of the crash that ended her Winter Olympic Games.

item.title: Border Force launches operation targeting illegal foreign fishing off Queensland coast
item.description: Authorities announce a special effort to crack down on illegal foreign fishing boats after intercepting 10 boats in Queensland waters since New Year's Day alone.

item.title: AI-generated social media posts like a 'snake eating its own tail'
item.description: The age of AI is here and it's going to be infinitely useful, or so they tell us, unless you're the kind of person who, like me, finds computer-generated stories infinitely boring and an insult to humanity.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Milano Cortina organisers looking into broken medals after at least four incidents
item.description: Records are meant to be broken at the Olympics, but in the Milano Cortina Games, it is the medals being dismantled, and organisers are giving it "maximum attention".

item.title: Bondi Beach terrorist Sajid Akram voiced support for Islamic State in 2019, former ASIO agent says
item.description: Bondi Beach terrorist Sajid Akram voiced support for the Islamic State group (IS) in 2019 and expressed admiration for a leading Al Qaeda propagandist, according to accounts from two men who moved in the same extremist circles.

item.title: Broken Hill artist exhibits in Japan after brush with J-pop star Fujii Kaze
item.description: When Broken Hill artist Jason McCarthur started receiving emails from Japan about his tote bags, he assumed they were a scam. But pretty soon he had sold out of the bags and it was all thanks to a J-pop star.

item.title: Margot Robbie and Jacob Elordi on the new film adaptation of classic novel Wuthering Heights
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: International condemnation of new Israeli settlement measures in West Bank grows
item.description: The United Nations says it is "gravely concerned" over Israeli plans to expand control over the occupied West Bank.

item.title: Licensed program to kill native animals 'weak' and 'outdated' inquiry told
item.description: Animal welfare groups are calling for a major overhaul into the system that allows native animals to be killed in NSW.

item.title: DNA breakthrough uncovers link between cold-case sexual assaults on Central Coast beaches
item.description: Police say they have identified a vehicle suspected to have been driven by a man who sexually assaulted a number of women on the Central Coast between 1997 and 2000.

item.title: NT Child Deaths Review Committee disbanded by government, with concerns it will result in 'serious gaps'
item.description: The NT Children's Commissioner says the government's decision to scrap a committee tasked with examining all child deaths in the territory leaves "serious gaps".

item.title: Queensland government dismisses concerns about Fitzroy River as 2032 Brisbane Olympics venue
item.description: The future of rowing and canoeing events being held in a controversial central Queensland venue choice for the 2032 Brisbane Olympic and Paralympic Games is still being assessed by international bodies.

item.title: Man accused of manufacturing pipe bombs in Canberra pleads not guilty
item.description: The man accused of manufacturing 15 pipe bombs found along Canberra footpaths last month pleads not guilty in court.

item.title: NSW Police disrupt muslim men praying outside Sydney's Town Hall
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Steven Bradbury clips Jake Paul as Ukrainian pays tribute — quick hits from Milano Cortina day three
item.description: Steven Bradbury hits Jake Paul with a drive-by as he celebrates Jutta Leerdam's Olympic gold, while a Sydney-born Kiwi receives a special celebration. Here are the quick hits from the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Turnbull says Coalition too concerned with approval of Sky News audience
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 4, Tuesday, February 10
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Gold Coast's Mona Wiggins celebrates 105th birthday with game of lawn bowls
item.description: Mona Wiggins is showing no signs of slowing down, celebrating her 105th birthday on the bowling green.

item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell was complicit in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse. Now she's pushing for clemency
item.description: Powerful socialite Ghislaine Maxwell was able to exploit her connections to recruit, groom, and abuse dozens of young girls. Now, she faces a fresh interrogation over her role in Jeffrey Epstein's abuse.

item.title: Christchurch attacker was pleased when terrorism charge laid, court hears
item.description: A former lawyer for the Australian who murdered 51 people at two New Zealand mosques in 2019 tells a court the shooter "never wanted to defend the terrorism charge".

item.title: Qld government to make mental health clinicians flag 'high-risk' patients in gun licence crackdown
item.description: A raft of new gun laws in response to the Wieambilla shooting falls short of mandatory mental health checks for gun licence applicants.

item.title: Commonwealth asks to meet Roblox following reports of child grooming. Here's what we know
item.description: Roblox has been called to an urgent meeting with the federal government in the wake of reports that children are being groomed by predators and exposed to sexually explicit material on the popular online gaming platform.
